feed.title: PA/Allegheny County Covid Report
feed.subtitle: A daily report of cases, hospitalizations, and ICU status for PA, with commentary about variants

entry.content:
Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-08-17

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2577 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are -1 to 206
ICUs are +3 to 22 (72% full)
7 day avg rises to 411 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Med-High

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 18117 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are -45 to 1256
ICUs are -15 to 146 (79% full)
7 day avg rises to 2995 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines move to 453 1st+2nd doses, 196 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 70.1%, 52.6% of those are boosted, 21.5% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 17165 med/surg beds, 151 less than last week, 79 more than 2 weeks ago.
(Still a somewhat elevated number.)

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-08-10

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2042 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +26 to 207
ICUs stay at 19 (71% full)
7 day avg drops to 292 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Ehh (*)

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 20626 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +37 to 1301
ICUs are +5 to 131 (78% full)
7 day avg to 2902 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Commentary

The CDC community level state is uncertain. The official view updates tomorrow. We're likely in Medium from hospital admissions but that data hasn't updated.

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines move to 411 1st+2nd doses, 183 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 70%, 52.5% of those are boosted, 21.2% of boosted got 4th dose.

10.9% of Allegheny County kids 6mo-4 have started vaccination.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid:
Venago (2 +covid pts in ICU)
Clearfield (1)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 17548 med/surg beds, 175 more than last week, 185 more than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-08-03

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2661 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations stay at 181
ICUs are +4 to 19 (71% full)
7 day avg stays around to 379 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Med

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 24748 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations stay around 1190
ICUs jump up to 143 (79% full)
7 day avg drops a bit to 3092 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines rise to 554 1st+2nd doses, 195 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.9%, 52.4% of those are boosted, 20.7% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid:
Clearfield (2 +covid patients in ICU)
Lawrence (2)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 17373 med/surg beds, 10 more than last week, 108 less than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-07-27

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2629 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are -2 to 181
ICUs are -2 to 15 (71% full)
7 day avg rises to 375 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 22277 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +58 to 1188
ICUs move down to 118 (78% full)
7 day avg rises to 3142 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines move to 461 1st+2nd doses, 201 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.7%, 52.3% of those are boosted, 20% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 17363 med/surg beds, 118 less than last week, 47 more than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-07-20

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2205 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations rise to 183
ICUs stay at 17 (71% full)
7 day avg drops to 310 cases/day (*) Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 20240 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations rise to 1130
ICUs wiggle down to 126 (78% full)
7 day avg rises to 2820 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Commentary

Hospitalizations and cases rose statewide over the last two weeks; not sure how to interpret Allegheny's drop yet. Like many other places, we're not (yet?) seeing ICU use rise, and while there's lag there, that's also bolstered by the decreasing number of people with no existing immunity either from vaccination or infection.

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines jump to 411 1st+2nd doses, 194 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

That's probably 6mo-4yo starting to happen

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.6%, 52.3% of those are boosted, 19.3% of boosted got 4th dose.

PA reporting that 3.3% of 6mo-4y now had at least 1 dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: Clearfield (2 +covid pts in ICU, of 24 total ICU beds)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 17481 med/surg beds, 165 more than last week, 1561 more than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-07-13

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2431 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are -2 to 160
ICUs are +0 to 17 (71% full)
7 day avg rises to 347 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 19947 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +94 to 1036
ICUs are +11 to 130 (78% full)
7 day avg rises to 2678 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines move to 181 1st+2nd doses, 143 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.5%, 52.1% of those are boosted, 18.4% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 17316 med/surg beds, 1396 more than last week, 671 more than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-07-06

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 1859 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +0 to 142
ICUs are +2 to 15 (71% full)
7 day avg stays around 233 cases/day (*)
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 17081 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are -6 to 1054
ICUs are -1 to 99 (78% full)
7 day avg drops to 2078 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Commentary

Due to the 4th, today's case reports may be somewhat lower than they should be, though how much of an effect it will have is hard to estimate - likely not huge.

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines drop to 201 1st+2nd doses, 168 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.4%, 52% of those are boosted, 18% of boosted got 4th dose.

PA has not yet broken out under 5 vax.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: Clearfield (3 +covid patients in ICU)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16549 med/surg beds, 365 less than last week, 356 less than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-06-29

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 1466 new cases over the last week.
Hospitalizations are +3 to 136
ICUs are -1 to 19 (71% full)
7 day avg stays at 234 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 13691 new cases over the last week.
Hospitalizations are +13 to 1032
ICUs are -16 to 89 (77% full)
7 day avg rises a bit to 2225 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Commentary

Cases have plateaued in Allegheny County and rose very slightly in the state, as did hospitalizations. ICU use has continued to drop a bit (it lags cases even more). Cases in NY, NJ, VA have been slowly rising, likely presaging a BA.5 driven slow rise in PA over the coming two weeks.

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines move to 223 1st+2nd doses, 209 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg) (Due to lag, not likely to see <5 vax here yet)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.3%, 51.7% of those are boosted, 17.2% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16645 med/surg beds, 39 more than last week, 22 less than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-06-22

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 1677 new cases over the last week.
Hospitalizations are +0 to 151
ICUs are -7 to 21 (72% full)
7 day avg drops to 234 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 15001 new cases over the last week.
Hospitalizations are +18 to 1025
ICUs are -21 to 109 (78% full)
7 day avg drops to 2097 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines at 243 1st+2nd doses, 222 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.2%, 51.6% of those are boosted, 16.6% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: Clearfield, with 2 +covid patients in the ICU.

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16905 med/surg beds, 29 more than last week, 69 less than 2 weeks ago. Like covid hospitalizations statewide, generally flat, but the drop in ICU use is nice.

With 6mo-5y vaccinations rolling out, expect the total % vaccinated to probably go from 69% to 70 or 71% after a month or so depending on uptake. Won't have huge effects on transmission but will help reduce pediatric cases. Down from peak, but # ped hosp is still elevated.

Note that graph is hospital admissions; There are 30 pediatric patients hospitalized with covid statewide right now.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-06-15

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 1998 new cases over the week.
Hospitalizations are -5 to 163
ICUs are +2 to 17 (71% full)
7 day avg drops to 281 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Medium

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 17606 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +12 to 1097
ICUs are -3 to 109 (78% full)
7 day avg drops to 2458 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Discussion

Cases are coming down well in Allegheny County. Handwavy, but hospitalizations appear to be dropping about as expected given the 1-2 week lag we typically see.

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines stay around 296 1st+2nd doses, 279 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69.1%, 51.4% of those are boosted, 15.8% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16876 med/surg beds, 98 less than last week, 28 more than 2 weeks ago. Fairly stable. Would be good for everyone to reduce # of covid+ patients.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-06-08

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2891 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +9 to 172
ICUs are -2 to 16 (71% full)
7 day avg drops to 412 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: High

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 22564 new cases.
Hospitalizations are -29 to 1213
ICUs are -11 to 133 (78% full)
7 day avg drops to 3116 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Discussion

Last week was affected by Memorial Day; today's data may still be slightly low b/c of it, but last week was more affected by it; trend over three weeks: 623 -> 471 -> 412 cases/day; state: 4304 -> 346 -> 3116.

"True" cases are definitely down from last week, and likely down from two weeks ago, though perhaps not by quite as much as it appears. Overall it's probably safe to say cases peaked two weeks ago. This is backed up by hospitalizations barely starting to go down over the last few days (they lag cases by a week or two).

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines drop to 284 1st+2nd doses, 261 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 69%, 51.2% of those are boosted, 14.6% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid:
Clearfield (1 +covid patient in ICU)
Schuylkill (2)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16974 med/surg beds, 126 more than last week, 77 less than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-06-01

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 3745 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +8 to 193
ICUs are +3 to 16 (71% full)
7 day avg down to 471 cases/day (**)
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: High

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 28388 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +13 to 1329
ICUs are +8 to 151 (79% full)
7 day avg drops to 3346 cases/day (**)
Transmission risk: High

Caveats apply to today's drop: There were very few cases reported for Memorial Day, so this may artificially reduce the average. Despite that, it looks like cases are dropping, but how much is hard to say until next week.

Vaccinations

Alleghey County daily vaccines move to 334 1st+2nd doses, 331 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 68.8%, 51% of those are boosted, 13.5% of boosted got 4th dose as of last week.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16848 med/surg beds, 203 less than last week, 299 less than 2 weeks ago.

(Fairly stable hospitalization levels still; Covid is adding some pain but nothing like previous waves.)

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-05-25

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 4365 new cases over 7 days
Hospitalizations are -3 to 176
ICUs are +1 to 17 (71% full)
7 day avg rises to 623 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Medium

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 30341 new cases over 7 days.
Hospitalizations are +14 to 1246
ICUs are -12 to 136 (78% full)
7 day avg rises to 4304 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Alleghey County daily vaccine rate is 334 1st+2nd doses, 227 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

68.8% of Allegheny County is fully vaccinated; 51% of those are boosted, and 13.5% of the boosted have had a second booster.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16672 med/surg beds, 216 less than last week, 67 more than 2 weeks ago.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-05-18

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 3387 new cases over 7 days
Hospitalizations are +7 to 156
ICUs are -2 to 15 (71% full)
7 day avg rises to 484 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Medium

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 27379 new cases over 7 days
Hospitalizations are +42 to 1132
ICUs are +15 to 128 (78% full)
7 day avg rises to 3832 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines move to 358 1st+2nd doses, 221 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16888 med/surg beds, 283 more than last week, 244 more than 2 weeks ago.

Commentary

Hospitalizations and ICU use continue slow rise. Statewide hospitalizations are about half what they were in previous waves at similar case levels, but are still rising; our vaccination rates are helping but we could still be doing quite a bit better.

New York has flattened again after their BA.2.12.1-fueled rise; Philadelphia County has also, which is possibly contributing to some slowdown in PA-wide cases. Western PA likely doesn't have quite the same levels of 2.12.1 yet; it's just a few days too early to try to interpret that possible-slowing in cases here.

It remains excellent weather to try to use the outdoors as a source of ventilation to reduce spread. At least until it hits 90 this weekend.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-05-11

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 2254 new cases for the week
Hospitalizations are -13 to 106 from last week
ICUs are +0 to 16 (71% full)
7 day avg rises to 363 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Medium

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 18196 new cases for the week
Hospitalizations are +30 to 855 from last week
ICUs are -4 to 94 (77% full)
7 day avg rises to 2945 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Alleghey County daily vaccines at 320 1st+2nd doses, 206 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16605 med/surg beds, 39 less than last week, 62 less than 2 weeks ago.

Commentary

Last couple of days have seen a faster increase in cases in both county and state. Likely BA.2.12.1, which CDC estimates is now 42.6% nationally but 48% in our region (for 5/7, so higher now).

Allegheny slipping into CDC's "Medium" community level (which is already much more loose than the old "high" transmission level), is a good reminder for people & organizations to check in on their thresholds for things like masking and moving activities outside.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-05-04

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 289 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +14 to 113
ICUs are -3 to 15 (71% full)
7 day avg stays around 246-252 cases/day Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 2615 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +27 to 758
ICUs are -3 to 81 (77% full)
7 day avg rises to 2096 cases/day
Transmission risk: High

Vaccinations

Alleghey County daily vaccines move to 341 1st+2nd doses, 218 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 68.3%, 50.5% of those are boosted, 8% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid:
Clearfield (4 +covid patients in ICU)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16854 med/surg beds, 14 less than last week, 363 more than 2 weeks ago.

Probably a bit up due to covid load.

The PA Department of Health did not update the data feeds again today. See Friday's report for some explanation of the feeds. Graphs will return when DOH fixes the data feeds.

Gathering data from other sources:

Allegheny County

Allegheny County reports 198 new cases today.
Hospitalizations are +8 to 99 beds used;
ICUs are +1 to 18 ICU beds used.
7 day average cases rise to 251 cases/day
Transmission level: High
Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 1466 new cases
Hospitalizations are +46 to 731 beds used
ICUs are +2 to 84 ICU beds used
7 day average rises to 2048 cases/day
Transmission level: High

Commentary and Variants

+Covid hospitalizations continue to rise a bit faster than a week ago.

CDC estimates BA.2.12.1 now 36.5% of cases in US; continuing to outpace BA.2 but at a slightly slower rate than BA.2 outpaced BA.1. So there's some more growth left.

The PA Department of Health did not update the data feeds again today. See Friday's report for some explanation of the feeds. Graphs will return when DOH fixes the data feeds.

Gathering data from other sources:

Allegheny County

Allegheny County reported 247 new cases today. Hospitalizations are up to 91 beds used;
ICUs are up up to 17 ICU beds used.
7 day average cases rises to 247 cases/day (not a typo, same as the new cases)
Transmission level: High
Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 1466 new cases
Hospitalizations are up to 685 beds used
ICU use rises to 82 ICU beds used
7 day average rises to 1967 cases/day
Transmission level: High

No updates; the PA Department of Health did not update the data feeds again today. See Friday's report for some explanation of the feeds.

Data from the PA covid alerting app suggests continued growth in daily cases for both PA and Allegheny County but without confirming which data source it comes from, holding off reporting precise numbers. Covid+ hospitalizations statewide increased from 621 on Thursday to 651 today.

(The fact that the app is still working suggests the problem is only in getting data from PA-NEDSS into PA Open Data, so hopefully that will be fixed tomorrow.)
No updates; the PA Department of Health did not update the data feeds again today. See yesterday's report for some explanation of the feeds.

No updates; the PA Department of Health did not update the data feeds today.

(For those interested, an example data feed is COVID-19 Aggregate Cases Current Daily County Health. The feeds are normally updated at 11:35am Eastern time, with the feed specifying that "Data will be updated between 11:30 am to 1:30pm every day." It's not unusual for the state to skip an update every couple of weeks, and no cause for alarm.)

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-04-28

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 314 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +1 to 81.
ICUs are +3 to 12 (70% full).
7 day avg rises to 226 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 2564 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +35 to 621.
ICUs are +3 to 63 (77% full).
7 day avg rises to 1710 cases/day
Transmission risk: Substantial

Today's results reflect 23601 new PCR test results

Vaccinations

Daily vaccinations count did not update today

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 68.3%, 50.5% of those are boosted, 7.4% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: Clearfield (1 +covid patient in ICU)

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16894 med/surg beds, 401 more than last week, 195 more than 2 weeks ago.

Overall hospital bed use may be rising a bit.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-04-27

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 333 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +8 to 80.
ICUs are +1 to 9 (69% full).
7 day avg rises to 211 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 2173 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +48 to 586.
ICUs are -1 to 60 (77% full).
7 day avg rises to 1595 cases/day
Transmission risk: Substantial

Today's results reflect 19629 new PCR test results

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines wiggle down to 375 1st+2nd doses, 246 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 68.3%, 50.5% of those are boosted, 7.4% of boosted got 4th dose.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid: None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16868 med/surg beds, 377 more than last week, 63 more than 2 weeks ago, still normalish.

Statewide covid+ hospitalizations jumped a lot again today.

Commentary

Cases in Philly continue dropping while cases in Allegheny are rising still.

entry.title: About the PA Covid Report
entry.content:
This is a competely unofficial compilation of data from the PA Department of Health, the Allegheny County Department of Health, the Western PA Regional Datacenter, and the CDC. The author has no affiliation with any of the data sources, and no financial interest in anything covid-related.

As I note on my twitter account where all this started, I (David Andersen) am neither a virologist, epidemiologist, or medical professional. So I do encourage you to let me know if anything I say conflicts with what you're hearing from experts, and trust them first and foremost.

Why do I feel qualified to do this, then? I do have a background in biology, with a BS in biology and having spent a small part of my Ph.D. working on computational biology. As a computer science professor, I spend a lot of time on data analysis.

Why you might find value in these reports: I try to integrate what we're hearing from experts with a lot of Pennsylvania and Pittsburgh-specific data analysis, because understanding the quirks of the local data and situation is helpful in making sense of it. Every covid data source has its quirks (unfortunately), and context does matter.

The code that puts the reports together is open source, written in Rust (mostly for fun, it probably would have been easier in Python).

Primary data sources

  • PA Cases
  • PA Hospitalization
  • WPRDC
  • CDC Variant Proportions

This site and credits

Site generated using the Zola static website generator using the Anpu theme. This site collects privacy-focused analytics using goatcounter; no cookies or personal information are tracked. Image support using glightbox. The site is hosted on github pages.

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-04-26

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 156 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +13 to 72
ICUs are -3 to 8 (69% full)
Step0 7 day avg to 197 cases/day
Step1 7 day avg to 189 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level:

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 1538 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +37 to 538
ICUs are -8 to 61 (77% full)
Step0 7 day avg to 1501 cases/day
Step1 7 day avg to 1507 cases/day
Transmission risk: Substantial

Today's results reflect 13129 new PCR test results

Vaccinations

Allegheny County daily vaccines stay around 381 1st+2nd doses, 257 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 68.3%, 50.4% of those are boosted.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid:
None

PA-wide hospital census: Using 16667 med/surg beds, 332 more than last week, 51 more than 2 weeks ago.

Statewide covid+ hospitalizations jumped a bit today, have to see what happens.

Variants

CDC estimates BA.2.12.1 at 28%, still growing well but a little more slowly than BA.2 did; dominant in NY now. Cases in NY have been growing fairly slowly despite that shift - one suspects would be dropping otherwise. Cases & wastewater in MA trending down (but w/out as much 12)

Allegheny County & Pennsylvania #covid hospitalization & variants thread for 2022-04-25

Allegheny County

Allegheny reports 144 new cases.
Hospitalizations are +6 to 59
ICUs are +3 to 11 (70% full)
7 day avg stays at 191 cases/day
Transmission risk: High
CDC Community level: Low

Pennsylvania

Pennsylvania reports 1072 new cases.
Hospitalizations are -3 to 501
ICUs are +5 to 69 (77% full)
7 day avg rises to 1486 cases/day
Transmission risk: Substantial

Alleghey County daily vaccines drop to 381 1st+2nd doses, 247 booster doses/day (5 day lagged 7 day avg)

Fully vaccinated %s:

Allegheny County: 68.3%, 50.4% of those are boosted.

Hospitalizations

PA counties with full ICU beds due to covid:

PA-wide hospital census: Using 15971 med/surg beds, 393 more than last week, 84 less than 2 weeks ago.

Statewide covid+ hospitalizations continue to hang out between 500-509.

Variants

Little news on variants. Boston and Ontario wastewater continue a likely slow drop. New York cases continue slow rise. We'll get an updated BA.2.12.1 estimate from CDC tomorrow.

For the NE US, a question will be how BA.2.12.1 compares to BA.4 & 5, rising in South Africa.

(I'm kind of suggesting that we probably don't need to worry about all of them, even if one of them is able to cause cases to rise a bit longer in New York and, once it spreads, elsewhere. But this is a relatively low confidence hunch based upon similar-looking advantages.)
